answerText: The Optimist's Daughter [10] This other novel by the author of The Optimist's Daughter is loosely based on a German Fairy Tale. It opens with Mike Fink meeting the title character, Jamie Lockhart. Jamie goes on to kidnap and fall in love with Rosamund, the daughter of Clement Musgrove.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | VCU + Michigan State  | 10 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In this work, a woman travels to New Orleans to take care of her father following a botched surgery, and later travels to Mississippi with her young step-mother to bury him. For 10 points each: [10] Name this novel about Laurel and Fay's interactions with the residents of Mount Salus, the winner of the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction in 1971.
